programme.title: Baywatch

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: ''Muddy Waters'' - Cort and Eddie train lifeguards at a water park, but someone is vandalizing the waterslides, putting people's lives in danger. Meanwhile, Captain Thorpe wants Shauni fired for posing in a provocative calendar.

programme.title: Baywatch

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: ''War of Nerves'' - Drug lord Mason Sato is released from prison and determined to seek revenge Mitch Buchannon, who helped send him away. When Sato kidnaps Hobie and Kaye, Mitch and Sato end up in a samurai-style fight to the death.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: ''Big Monday'' - Reports of a coming storm and enormous waves bring painful memories for Mitch. Meanwhile, Kaye tries to persuade the parents of a deaf girl to send her to sign-language school.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: ''Sea of Flames'' - A drugged-out drifter torches Eddie's lifeguard tower which leads the team to discover an illegal, lab distributing a new drug. Mitch and Thorpe try to convince the city board to buy wave runners in order to optimize their ability to save lives.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: ''The Chamber'' - Mitch has an out-of-body experience when his attempt to save a trapped diver without scuba gear leaves him with the bends, dangerously close to death and in desperate need of a decompression chamber.

programme.title: Baywatch
programme.desc: ''Strangers Among Us'' - Mitch and Stephanie cope with an odd assembly of UFO enthusiasts camping on the beach in anticipation of an extraterrestrial visitation. Smugglers threaten Summer to recover diamonds they hid inside a surfboard Slade gave her.

programme.title: Submarines: The Invisible Weapon
programme.desc: You can’t see them. You can’t hear them. And you never know exactly where they are. The life of submarines is secret and fascinating. In this film, we go inside one of the French navy's legendary vessels, the Rubis, and to where the next nuclear submarine, the Barracuda, is being built. From technological prowess to human exploits, the film submerges us in a timeless amphibian adventure.

programme.title: Saving Sharks, Raising Awareness
programme.desc: Every hour 10,000 sharks are fished worldwide. Yet, this mythical predator plays a key role in regulating marine life. So now, Jérôme Delafosse has launched The Shark Project - a plea to reconcile humankind with the scary shark - and is traveling the globe to raise awareness about these marvelous animals. Can Jérôme save our sharks from possible extinction?

programme.title: Africa's Primeval Oceans
programme.desc: The scene is the southern tip of Africa. Just off shore, two very different seas meet to form one of the most diverse marine environments on earth. The meeting of icy Atlantic and warm Indian waters not only affect life underwater, they are giant forces that shape the land, climate, and all its creatures. The Portuguese explorer Bartholomew Dias and his crew called it the Cape of Storms.

programme.title: Jess
programme.desc: Environmental philosophy student Jessica is looking to go beyond the surfing experience and see what more the ocean has to offer. Hanli steps up and instructs Jessica in the art of free diving. Her first dive is in a protected cove in a Marine Protected Area in False bay. The episode ends on a high note as Jessica and the crew enjoy an encounter with a pod of pilot whales.

programme.title: Erica
programme.desc: Marine biologist Erica has spent the past eleven years researching the smallest life forms in the ocean, phytoplankton. Through Erica’s eyes, the role of these microorganisms in the marine ecosystem is clarified. Her dream is to swim with humpback whales, so David and his team are determined to make it happen.

programme.title: Monwabisi
programme.desc: Monwa’s life is tied to the sea. However, his relationship to the marine environment is based in fear. David and the crew aim to help him overcome this fear by getting him into the water. Monwa learns to free dive, and once the crew is satisfied that he can handle more, Monwa takes the plunge and swims with blue sharks in an underwater canyon off the coast of the Cape of Good Hope.

programme.title: Life On Us: A Microscopic Safari
programme.desc: Just like planet Earth, our body is composed of diverse landscapes surprising wildlife. This award-winning film offers a unique microscopic safari, encountering the creatures that live, compete, feed, on breed on the surface or in the depths of our body. Some may seem harmful, others are useful and even essential to our survival, but all participate in the biological balance of the human body.

programme.title: Paseka: The Easter Elephant
programme.desc: On Easter morning, a baby elephant is mysteriously abandoned by her herd in the wilds of Botswana’s Okavango Delta. Saved from certain death by a bizarre chain of events, she forces herself into a very unusual, captive elephant herd. This is “Paseka's” story.

programme.title: Renegade Bass Tour E5 - "Qualifier 5 - Newboro Lake" (2020)
programme.desc: The Renegade Bass Tour finishes off the regular season on Newboro Lake where the Traeger Team of the Year and Classic Qualifiers will be decided.

programme.title: Guides Day Off S1:E1 "Tacos and Rojos"
programme.desc: The plan is to bag some snapper meat for tacos, then get shallow for some heart pumping redfish action.

programme.title: Breaking Point S7:E8 "Southern Comfort"
programme.desc: Brennen got his first taste of Oklahoma behind the camera filming Mike last year, and he couldn’t wait to get back down there with a tag of his own in his pocket. A late November trip was made to set cameras, stands, and blinds. It didn’t take long for the cell cameras to show that several good bucks were in the area. Brennen took the hint and headed back south. On the second day of the hunt, the target buck they were after slipped up and came into bow range.

programme.title: Breaking Point S7:E7 "Bittersweet"
programme.desc: In late October, just days after Ryan had punched his archery tag on the lease in Wisconsin, Dylan would get an opportunity at one of their target bucks. A less than perfect shot would lead to a failed recovery, and an unsettling feeling in Dylan’s stomach. It didn’t take long for the buck to show back up on the trail cameras, and Dylan was ready to get back after him. It wouldn’t be until opening day of the Wisconsin firearm season when the story for this buck would come to a close.

programme.title: Tails From The Dark Side Episode 16
Reel West Coast S2:E5 Haida Gwaii Hali
programme.desc: Haida Gwaii is a place of history, legend and mysticism. Known for once in a lifetime fish, Brendan heads to Queen Charlotte Lodge and battles a massive Halibut in an unforgettable battle.

programme.title: Reel West Coast S2:E6 Fraser Valley Chums
programme.desc: rendan and Brian Roth from BD Diesel head to Rowena’s Inn on the River and spend the day catching Chum salmon on spinning gear. Then they go out to get Brian’s dream fish - a monster sturgeon.

programme.title: Fish Addictions S6:E7 "Crushing Jumbo Perch" Ice Fishing on Unfamiliar Lakes pt 2
programme.desc: Part 2 picks up right where Part 1 left off. The guys have a few lakes ahead, plus an insane night bite surprise!

programme.title: Fish Addictions S6:E8 Lake of The Woods Family Fishing
programme.desc: Now one thing that we find important here at Fish Addictions, is passing down the passion that we all share for the outdoors, onto the younger generation. Thanks to Big Bite, Mike has been able to bring the family along for an unforgettable weekend packed with fun and a few great fish.

programme.title: Two Conchs Sportfishing TV S2:E8 "Two Conchs Fish Camp"
programme.desc: Each year Jack and the Two Conchs crew like to put on a fishing camp. This is an educational few days of fishing that is both good for clients and the crew.

programme.title: Two Conchs Sportfishing TV S2:E9 "Lobstering Becomes A Rescue Mission"
programme.desc: With the Harvest of Lobster being regulated to just a Mini Season, when the time comes everybody is out on the water trying to get their limit.

programme.title: Benelli Presents: Donnie Vincent’s Winds of Adak
programme.desc: In November of 2019, explorer and hunter Donnie Vincent traveled to Adak Island, Alaska. Located at the westernmost end in the Aleutian chain, Adak is wilderness with the exception of a now-abandoned naval base that once housed more than 6,000 people. Winds of Adak chronicles Donnie’s exploration of the island, a hauntingly desolate abandoned military outpost and three unique hunts—caribou, ptarmigan and sea ducks—as the unforgiving elements, the terrain and the Bering Sea test both man and equipment.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Kim Kerley - Do You Know Her?
programme.desc: Having spent much of her teens homeless, Kim Kerley has seen things in life that many never see. She’s chosen to find the funny in those situations. A keen observer of life’s crazy conditions, her comedy comes from real life. A regular on San Antonio Living, Kim has been performing stand-up comedy for over 13 years. She has traveled extensively in the U.S. and abroad, including an inspiring stint with Armed Forces Entertainment. She was also an actress with the comedy group, Laff Stock. She is an actor with Dramatic Diva Productions, putting on community plays in the San Antonio area. Kim also performed comedy on “The View”. She helmed San Antonio’s number 2 drive-time morning radio show. She also handled production duties for Cox Media in San Antonio and was also on the Y-100 morning show. She has shared the stages with comedy greats like Carlos Mencia, Ron White, Lewis Black and many others.

programme.title: Tom Clark - I'm A Rescue
programme.desc: Tom Clark was born and raised, in that order. Clark’s mix of well-crafted jokes and spontaneous crowd work has led to appearances on TBS’s ‘Conan,’ CBS’s ‘Late Late Show, and Comedy Central’s ‘Premium Blend’. Clark has traveled coast to coast doing stand up and has performed internationally as part of New Faces at the prestigious‘Just For Laughs Comedy Festival’ in Montreal and on The Main Stage at ‘The Capetown Comedy Festival’ in South Africa. Clark is also an actor and has appeared on such shows as NBC’s ‘Outsourced’, TNT’s ‘The Closer’,and the Hallmark made for TV movie ‘The Wish List’. After landing the role on ‘Outsourced,’ director Ken Kwapis invited Clark to be in the Drew Barrymore movie, ‘Big Miracle’. You can also see Clark in Columbia Pictures ‘Freaks of Nature.’

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Tommy Drake - Mouse
programme.desc: Tommy’s unique mixture of original material delivered in a classic style has given him the opportunity to do more shows and be seen by more people live than just about any other comic on the planet.

programme.title: Don Barnhart - The Spinal Disintegration of Man
programme.desc: Don’s ability to keep audiences of all ages howling with laughter and coming back for more is what separates him from the average joke teller.

programme.title: Alex Velluto - Spurious
programme.desc: Like Rocky Balboa, Alex Velluto is the son of an Italian immigrant and brings the same intensity, will, and drive to the comedy stage. In 2016, Alex was voted 'Best Comedian' by City Weekly Magazine and is the winner of the Finger Lakes Comedy Festival in Ithaca, NY. Alex is a regular at Wiseguys Comedy Club where he has headlined and worked with some of the biggest names in comedy. He has also “gone the distance” in many competitions and festivals across the country. Alex was a finalist in the the Funniest Person in Utah competition, and The Salt Lake Comedy Festival stand up competition, has performed at the Idaho Laugh Festival, and Finger Lakes Comedy Festival. In addition to his stand-up comedy, Alex is a co-host of the "Happy Valley Podcast", and is renowned for referring to himself in the third person, and is an excellent writer of comedy bios about himself that everybody likes.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Mark Poolos - One Wife, Two Daughters, and Zero Influence
programme.desc: Mark stands 6'7" weighs in at 350 technically a giant however he is very weak and a wimp. In his routines, he weaves the story of his life as a bumbling jolly giant in his fast engaging storytelling style. He has been compared to Louie Anderson. Mark is a true road dog, performing in 40 states and all across Canada. Mark's ultimate dream is to do a film that people actually will have seen.

programme.title: Matt Falk - Un-Lit
programme.desc: Matt Falk was called “effortlessly funny” by the CBC. He’s performed at Just For Laughs, The Hal!fax Comedy Festival and the Winnipeg Comedy Festival. He was recently named one of the “Best of the Fest” at the Burbank Comedy Festival in California.

programme.title: Joe Devito - First Of All
programme.desc: Joe DeVito's dead-on timing and unexpected twists make him a favorite at comedy clubs across the USA. His TV appearances include The Late Late Show, Last Comic Standing, Comedy Central, Comics Unleashed, and AXStv’s Gotham Comedy Live. He’s also a regular on TV news panels, finding the funny in pop culture and current events. Joe’s albums First Date with Joe DeVito and Three’s Comedy are in regular rotation on SiriusXM radio.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Frances Dilorenzo - The Problem Solver
programme.desc: Frances takes the stage full of energy and ready for fun. Frances does one thing you don’t see many female comics do…physical humor, and she delivers it with every silly bone in her body. Her material stems from her life, but she draws both men and women into her world with such a connection, it feels like she is personalizing every joke. In addition to touring nationally, Frances Dilorinzo’s credits include appearances on Nick Mom Night Out – Nickelodeon, Last Comic Standing - NBC, Comics Unleashed -ABC, Secret Life of a Soccer Mom -TLC, Real Housewives of Orange County – Bravo, as well as, performing for our troops around the world.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Nick Guerra - Enjoy Life
programme.desc: Nick Guerra is loved by comedy audiences in clubs, corporate events, private parties, and colleges across the country, this guy tickles everyone’s funny bone with his cool but energetic attitude, as he skewers relationships, family, and everyday life.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Orlando Baxter - Glorified Baby Sitter
programme.desc: Orlando Baxter's fresh perspective and unique relatability makes this former high school teacher a fan favorite all over the world. In 2016, Orlando made his late night TV debut on the Conan show on TBS, and since then he's appeared on the television shows "Comedy Up Late" in Australia, B.E.T.'s "50 Central" and Laff Mobb's Laff Track on Tru TV.

programme.title: Dave Burleigh - Nobody's Keeping You Here
programme.desc: Comedian and Impressionist Dave Burleigh's star is on the rise. His uncanny ability to impersonate just about anyone landed him the starring role as Charlie Sheen in "Not Another Celebrity Movie." Burleigh's multiple characters, voices, and impressions were showcased on Season 7 of America's Got Talent, where he became a fast favorite of both judges and fans alike. Judge Howard Stern said, "You have an excellent command of the stage." Fellow comedian and judge Howie Mandel added, "Your impressions were spot on." Burleigh's laid back and easy going style and persona on stage contrasted with his unique facial and body expressions are guaranteed to leave audiences amazed and impressed. As a two-time finalist in the San Francisco Comedy Competition, Burleigh now shares the first runner-up spot with past participant comedy legends like Robin Williams, Ellen DeGeneres, Marc Maron, Dane Cook and Kevin Pollak. With numerous television, podcast and radio appearances, prestigious publications like Rolling Stone are talking, "Burleigh has the trappings of a soon to be comedy star!" This talented, singer, musician, actor, comedian and host tours the world over 36 weeks a year and headlines all the major casinos in Las Vegas. Make sure to catch Dave's show at a theater or comedy club near you, as he will no doubt, leave you with a lasting impression.

programme.title: Dry Bar Comedy:Cam Bertrand - Sophisticated Ignorance
programme.desc: Cam shares his outlook on relationships and life through the eyes of a 23-year-old in a way that everyone can relate to. Bringing high energy and witty style that appeals to a wide demographic.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff arrives to the stunning and historic Alaskan sea port of Seward and discovers amazing marine life at the Alaska Sea Life Center. To up the adventure, he takes a helicopter to nearby Godwin Glacier and rappels into a crevasse. Finally, Jeff enjoys a classic Alaskan fishing experience and prepares the delicious catch at beach cookout.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Catalina Island Jeff cruises along the California coastline to Catalina Island where he uses ancient maritime technology to navigate a historical sailing vessel. Then, he explores the island’s natural beauty and discovers American bison roaming the hills. Finally, Jeff experiences first hand why Jacques Cousteau raved about Catalina’s prime scuba diving in the kelp forest.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff and his daughter discover the wonders of Bermuda as they ride the pink sand beaches on horseback. Then, the Corwins team up with the Bermuda Aquarium to help protect the future of the national bird. Finally, father and daughter plunge into the mysteries of the Bermuda Triangle, each in their own way.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff kayaks around the Inian Islands on an epic adventure among the stellar marine wildlife before his ship arrives to Icy Strait Point. Then, he experiences a taste of the native Tlingit culture that’s been passed down for generations. Finally, Jeff rides into the Alaskan backcountry in search of the mighty brown bear!

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff’s ship brings him to Alesund, Norway, where he sails a Viking vessel and explores the historic culture. Then, a renowned chef delights Jeff with an epic gourmet experience as they forage for delicacies along the pristine shores. Finally, Jeff caps the day in Norway’s most famous fjord by climbing to see the ultimate Nordic vista.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff travels to Berlin, Germany, for the adventure of a lifetime. He visits Frederick the Great’s elaborate summer palace and learns the secrets of historical sculpture restoration. Then, Jeff gets a taste of classic German fare like pretzels. Finally, he explores the Berlin Wall with a former East German escapee.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff explores St. Petersburg, Russia, and discovers a glorious city with a majestic royal palace that’s steeped in history. Then, his adventure soars to new heights as he practices an ancient pastime of the czars. Finally, a local chef gives Jeff a delightful taste of Russian culture with some classic local delicacies.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff’s ship arrives to historic Split, on the beautiful coast of Croatia, where he explores an ancient Roman palace. Then, he slides, splashes, and sloshes through an awesome river canyon. Finally, Jeff discovers the buzz behind a local honey that’s been savored for thousands of years.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff cruises to the Mediterranean island of Sardinia where he discovers an ancient twist on Italian cuisine. Then, he joins conservationists to help save Europe’s 2nd largest bird species from extinction. Finally, Jeff gets a glimpse of Sardinia’s ancient past at an archaeological dig to help uncover the island’s multicultural history.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: (Best of- Catalina, Alesund, Seward, Bermuda) Jeff embarks on an international adventure in search of epic explorations. First, he sails an 18th century style vessel off the California coast. Then, he rappels into a massive glacier in Alaska. Next, Jeff discovers historical shipwrecks in Bermuda before capping his adventure by exploring the famous fjords of Norway.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: KUSHIRO Jeff arrives in Kushiro, Japan, and learns the secrets to making traditional ramen, a delicious noodle soup. Then, he explores a popular lake in search of giant algae balls and discovers their importance to Japanese culture. Finally, Jeff is immersed in the ancient customs of the native Ainu people.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff comes ashore in beautiful Marseille, France, and saddles up with the guardians of a cherished breed of rare white horses. Next, an acclaimed chocolatier helps Jeff discover the French connection to chocolate. Then, Jeff explores the historic castle made famous in the literary classic The Count of Monte Cristo.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff arrives in the bustling South Korean sea port of Busan where he experiences a spirited display of Korean culture in a colorful mask dance. Next, he explores the city’s famous market and discovers the key element to great Korean cuisine. Then, Jeff helps flight test some native birds of prey at a local wildlife center.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff and his daughter arrive to Freeport, Bahamas, and discover an amazing local effort to save the endangered Queen Conch. Next, they take their adventure below water to snorkel with sea turtles and dive through a sacred crystal cavern. Finally, the Corwins experience the thrill of deep sea fishing with the payoff of a true Bahamian beach cookout.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Jeff travels to Kyoto, Japan, and discovers a culturally rich city with a historical connection to Japan’s legendary swordsmen, the samurai. Then, he learns the 500-year-old fine art of Awaji puppetry. Finally, Jeff and a master confectioner handcraft ancient treats that were once reserved for the Japanese emperor.

programme.title: Ocean Treks with Jeff Corwin
programme.desc: Best of 2 Jeff travels the globe to experience a kaleidoscope of world cuisine. In Berlin, he discovers a comforting local favorite, the German pretzel. Then, Jeff enjoys a sumptuous bowl of ramen in Japan. In St. Petersburg, Russia, a local chef delights Jeff’s senses with homemade dumplings and borscht. Finally, he enjoys a freshly caught meal in the great outdoors of Alaska.
